boat.name: Trasnagh
boat.full_description:
'Trasnagh' an Island One Design by Alfred Mylne, was discovered as a bare hull by Ian Terblanche, who painstakingly restored her with the help from broker Peter Gregson and local boatbuilders Pete Nash and Brian Pomeroy. They achieved a high level of well researched authenticity. Teak decks were laid after seeing a photograph of her winning the King George Cup in 1927. Having been converted to Bermudan at some time during her earlier cruising and racing days, her original gaff rig has been restored.

'Trasnagh' won second place in the Classic Boat Restoration of the Year Award, 2014.
boat.short_description: Found as a bare hull, 'Trasnagh' has been restored to a very high standard, winning second place in the 2014 Classic Boat Restoration of the Year.
